intro: Pseudosabicea aurifodinae, commonly known as the golden-leaved pseudosabicea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are leathery and have a distinctive golden hue when mature, which gives it its common name. It is often found growing in shaded, moist environments within forest understories.
